We do have a new Spock in the new Star Trek movies which the director left to do Star Wars :|
topics.author: 505696b47f123b37e800effa

topics.body:
I just found out that Leonard Nimoy died today. I never knew the man, and yet I still feel absolutely miserable about his passing.

Spock was someone important to me, he more than any other fictional alien made me dream of life in the stars even as a child too immature to really understand what made Star Trek truly great. I also know him as the host of "In Search Of," a show all about things that I hate or find intellectually insulting made tolerable, or even something to be loved by Nimoy's narration.

His voice to me is that of rationality and logic, a light in the chaos of emotion and gleeful irrationality.

I'm gonna go watch Wrath of Khan and cry now.
